page.title: 05Vegetables:Demand:Chatteris
page.content: Demand has increased and there are now packing depots in Littleport, Crowland and Ramsey. The firm has offices in London and abroad. However the old machinery is disappearing. Potato packing is now done by {computerised machines.}Jobs have been lost through{natural wastage. Much of the produce is supplied to {supermarkets}such as Sainsburys. Their regulations are very strict. For example, not only do carrots have to be sorted according to size, but workers must wear special coat and hat for{hygiene}reasons and measures have to be taken to control pests. After packing vegetables are in cold store. Half of the firm's eighteen lorries are{refrigerated.}Some supermarkets do not accept produce if it has been allowed to go over a certain temperature.{
